MF.term: proton-dependent oligopeptide secondary active transmembrane transporter activity

interpro.desc: PTR2 family proton/oligopeptide symporter, conserved site

name: solute carrier family 15 member 1

kegg.name: Protein digestion and absorption - Homo sapiens (human)

reactome.name: Transport of inorganic cations/anions and amino acids/oligopeptides

summary: This gene encodes an intestinal hydrogen peptide cotransporter that is a member of the solute carrier family 15. The encoded protein is localized to the brush border membrane of the intestinal epithelium and mediates the uptake of di- and tripeptides from the lumen into the enterocytes. This protein plays an important role in the uptake and digestion of dietary proteins. This protein also facilitates the absorption of numerous peptidomimetic drugs. [provided by RefSeq, Apr 2010].
